title: Integration of Educational Leadership Beliefs and Blended Teaching Methods: Strengthening Mathematics Educational Leadership Capabilities and Problem-Solving Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts (calculations, formulas, equations) and intermediate-level application skills (problem-solving, graph interpretation)
context.additional_context: A program for undergraduate students in medical, legal, and technical professions to strengthen mathematical education leadership beliefs and blended teaching methodologies. Cultivates real-world problem-solving abilities through collaborative learning activities using personal devices, such as equation solving, statistical analysis, and probability modeling.

learning_goals: Learners will analyze their educational leadership beliefs through self-reflection tools and apply a balanced approach between transmissionist and constructivist perspectives to mathematical problem-solving strategies.

Learners will propose ≥3 specific strategies for designing formative assessments in mathematics education using blended teaching methods (e.g., graph analysis, probability-based assessments, case studies on formula applications).
Learners will present a case where they reconstructed their leadership beliefs based on peer feedback in group discussions and apply this to mathematical modeling or equation-solving.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
